page.title: 01LAND S. OF MACHLINE VILLAGE
page.content: This area is predominantly intensively managed grassland and grazing land for dairy cattle. There are several red sandstone quarries being infilled with waste products before being returned to grazing land. A main road travelling south passes through the north west corner of the block, closely followed by a main-line railway. Both pass over the Liner Ayr. A feature of this area is the largest single span stone built viaduct in the world. The only commercial or industrial projects are a creamery and an optical works, both occupying small sites near the river. The people who work there live mainly in the nearby villages of Machline, Catrine and Cumnock. There is a small general hospital in the north eastern corner of the block which is set in the grounds of a derelict mansion house -
